document.masterDocTitle: A new genus of huntsman spiders (Araneae, Sparassidae, Sparianthinae) from the Neotropical region

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new genus of huntsman spiders (Araneae, Sparassidae, Sparianthinae) from the Neotropical region

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 53–56.
Uaiuara quyguaba
sp. nov .
53–54 male, IBSP 55763, left palp (53 ventral, 54 retrolateral view); 55–56 female, IBSP 20796 (55 epigyne, ventral view, 56 vulva, dorsal view). Scale lines: 0.5 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology . The specific name is a noun in apposition taken from the Tupi Indian language that means “comb” and refers to the shape and setae of the retrolateral groove of the cymbium of the male palps.

Diagnosis . Males of
Uaiuara quyguaba
sp. nov
are distinguished from their congeners by the retrolateral groove very slightly longer than half the cymbium length, by a leaf-like projection at the retrolateral base of the cymbium and by the vRTA slightly horse-shoe shaped in ventral view (
Fig. 53
). Females resemble those of
U. barroana (Chamberlin)
comb. nov.
,
U. palenque
sp. nov.
and
U. ope
sp. nov.
by the subrectangular median septum of the epigyne ( Figs 35 , 47 , 51 , 55 ) and by the very long and strongly convoluted Cp in the vulva ( Figs 36 , 52 , 48 , 56 ). They are distinguished from the latter species by the Lp long, covering most of the Cp, with a slightly elongate gp arising at the junction of both parts of the duct (
Fig. 56
).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 57. Distribution map for
Uaiuara amazonica (Simon)
comb. nov.
,
Uaiuara dianae
sp. nov.
and
Uaiuara jirau
sp. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph: Variation. Males (n = 8 ): total length 3.8 –6.0; prosoma length 1.9–2.5 ; femur I length 1.9–2.7 . Females (n = 10 ): total length 4.6–7.1 ; prosoma length 2.1–2.8 ; femur I length 2.0– 2.8 .
